meanings.sent2: Clarences is a common name for boys.
meanings.sent3: At the party, everyone kept calling out Clarences, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: In the story, Clarences was the brave hero who saved the day.
meanings.sent5: The teacher always remembers Clarences because he is so polite.

meanings.definition: Clarence: a title of a British prince.
meanings.sent1: The royal family announced the arrival of Clarences.
meanings.sent2: Clarences is a prestigious title in England.
meanings.sent3: Imagine being addressed as Clarences wherever you go!
meanings.sent4: To the people, Clarences symbolizes tradition and heritage.
meanings.sent5: The young prince proudly accepted the title of Clarences.

meanings.sent1: I picked some delicious Clarences from the orchard.
meanings.sent2: Clarences are known for their sweet taste.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole all the Clarences from the tree.
meanings.sent4: The Clarences in the basket were ripe and juicy.
meanings.sent5: The market was full of vendors selling fresh Clarences.
